title: ACTION ICU Score for Intensive Care in NSTEMI
description: Predicts risk of NSTEMI complications requiring ICU care. This is a prognostic tool for emergency patients with non-ST elevation myocardial infarction (NSTEMI) to assess their risk of developing complications that would require intensive care unit (ICU) management.

parameters.name: heart_rate
parameters.description: Heart rate in beats per minute

parameters.name: troponin_ratio
parameters.description: Ratio of initial troponin to upper limit of normal

parameters.name: heart_failure_signs
parameters.description: Signs or symptoms of heart failure present

parameters.name: prior_revascularization
parameters.description: History of prior coronary revascularization (PCI or CABG)

parameters.name: chronic_lung_disease
parameters.description: Presence of chronic lung disease (COPD, asthma, etc.)

result.name: action_icu_score
result.description: ACTION ICU score for NSTEMI complications requiring ICU care

ranges.interpretation: Low risk of complications requiring ICU care. Consider standard cardiac monitoring and care on telemetry unit.
Intermediate risk of complications requiring ICU care. Consider enhanced monitoring and possible step-down unit care.
High risk of complications requiring ICU care. Consider direct ICU admission for intensive monitoring and management.

references: Fanaroff AC, Chen AY, Roe MT, et al. A Simple Risk Score to Predict In-Hospital Complications in Patients With Non-ST-Segment Elevation Myocardial Infarction. J Am Heart Assoc. 2018;7(11):e008108.
Alexander C. Fanaroff, MD, Duke Clinical Research Institute, Duke University Medical Center
formula: Points assigned: Age ≥70 years (+1), Creatinine ≥1.1 mg/dL (+1), HR 85-100 bpm (+1), HR ≥100 bpm (+3), SBP 125-145 mmHg (+1), SBP <125 mmHg (+3), Troponin ratio ≥12 (+2), Heart failure signs (+5), ST depression (+1), No prior revascularization (+1), Chronic lung disease (+2). Total score ranges 0-20 points.
notes: This calculator is not externally validated and should be used with caution
Intended for use in emergency patients with NSTEMI
Helps guide ICU admission decisions and resource allocation
Should be used in conjunction with clinical judgment
Higher scores indicate greater risk of complications requiring ICU-level care
